narrative.title: 9Th Infantry Division - 1943Q2
narrative.situation: American Triangular Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1943Q2.
narrative.objectives: Battle-tested US Army triangular infantry division transitioning from Tunisia Campaign victory to Sicily invasion preparation (June-July 1943). Successfully completed final Tunisia offensive (April-May 1943) contributing to Axis surrender of 275,000 troops. Division gained six months combat experience including hard lessons from Kasserine Pass defeat (February 1943) and redemption at El Guettar (March 1943). Preparing for Operation Husky amphibious assault on Sicily.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: coastal plains and urban areas (Bizerte, Tunisia); staging for amphibious operations

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Veteran amphibious operations (Port Lyautey, preparing for Sicily)
Proven anti-tank defense with upgraded 57mm guns
Experienced combined arms coordination from Tunisia battles
M1 Garand semi-automatic rifle standard issue
Six months sustained combat operations experience
Improved coordination with II Corps artillery and air support

environment.terrain_type: coastal plains and urban areas (Bizerte, Tunisia); staging for amphibious operations
